nodes.bodyText:
Have you tested if this event is emitted on a client when it receives the tags on game-join from the server?
@i509VCB Since you are the event-master, do you know this off the top of your head?
It doesn't, but 824377e addresses this issue!
Can't all of these turn into 1 single mixin at AbstractFurnaceBlockEntity#createFuelTimeMap returning the cached map?
It's a possibility. I'm not fond of it because it "leaks" an implementation detail (i.e. the cached map).
We would have to return an immutable map in this case which may change the semantics of anyone using the furnace. As such I'd probably just add getters in the fuel registry
This is effectively an overwrite, should be an inject

+package net.fabricmc.fabric.mixin.content.registry;
+
+import org.spongepowered.asm.mixin.Mixin;
+
+import net.minecraft.tag.TagManager;
+
+import net.fabricmc.fabric.impl.content.registry.FuelRegistryImpl;
+
+@Mixin(targets = "net.minecraft.tag.TagManager$1")
+public abstract class MixinTagManager implements TagManager {
+	public void apply() {

nodes.bodyText: I don't think it's possible to inject here because the apply method is a default from an interface. I tried injecting there first, but injection into default interface methods is not supported yet AFAIK.

nodes.bodyText: You are targeting an anonymous class? It should be possible to inject here I think. Of course I may be wrong

nodes.bodyText: So I injected into ClientNetworkPlayHandler and used the END_DATA_PACK_RELOAD event. That removes the need for the overwrite.

nodes.bodyText: Both new injects are soft overwrites, any other mod injecting here will never be handled.
Would it be better to inject just before createFuelTimeMap ? That should work too.
But if I were to do that, any mod injecting at TAIL for example still wouldn't work I think. Is it really reasonable to expect mods to be injecting stuff in these two functions?
If you want I can lower the priority on the mixin itself... that works too, doesn't it?
I personally dislike it but modmuss wants the mixin annotations to be one line
